SEARCH
Package example.app.services

Class FileDatabase<T>

java.lang.Object
example.app.services.FileDatabase<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatabaseInterface<T>
public class FileDatabase<T> extends Object implements DatabaseInterface<T>

Class FileDatabase

This class is used to interact with the files which is used as a database. It's a generic class, so it can be used to do the operations with any type of object.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    final void
    addEntry(String fileName, T... object)
    This method takes a variable number of arguments of a type of object and adds them into the specified database file.
    LinkedList<T>
    getAll(String fileName)
    This method reads the database partition (whose name was supplied as parameter), and returns a linked list of the objects or null in case the file does not exist.
    boolean
    isPresent(String fileName, T object)
    Checks if an object is present
    final void
    removeEntry(String fileName, T... object)

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      public LinkedList<T> getAll(String fileName) throws DatabaseOperationException
      This method reads the database partition (whose name was supplied as parameter), and returns a linked list of the objects or null in case the file does not exist. In case the path cannot be retrieved from the config file, or if there's a problem in reading the database file, it throws an DatabaseOperationException.
      Specified by:
      getAll in interface DatabaseInterface<T>
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the partition
      Returns:
      a linked list of objects or null in case the file does not exist
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - in case there's any problem reading the config file or the database file

    • addEntry

      @SafeVarargs public final void addEntry(String fileName, T... object) throws DatabaseOperationException
      This method takes a variable number of arguments of a type of object and adds them into the specified database file. In case it encounters a problem with reading the config file or adding operation, it will throw an DatabaseOperationException
      Specified by:
      addEntry in interface DatabaseInterface<T>
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the partition
      object - the objects to be added
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - in case there's any problem reading the config file or writing to the database file

    • removeEntry

      @SafeVarargs public final void removeEntry(String fileName, T... object) throws DatabaseOperationException
      This method takes a variable number of arguments of a type of object and removes them from the specified database file. In case it encounters a problem with reading the config file or in writing operation, it will throw an DatabaseOperationException
      Specified by:
      removeEntry in interface DatabaseInterface<T>
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the partition
      object - the objects to be removed
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - in case there's any problem reading the config file or in writing to the database file

    • isPresent

      public boolean isPresent(String fileName, T object) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Description copied from interface: DatabaseInterface
      Checks if an object is present
      Specified by:
      isPresent in interface DatabaseInterface<T>
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the partition
      object - the object to search for
      Returns:
      true if the object is present at least once in the database, false otherwise
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - in case there's any problem reading the config file or the database file
